Panos Birbas & Irini Qnâ€œMixtape Liveâ€Theatre of the NoSaturday, November 22

Panos Birbas and Irini Qn meet on stage at Theatre of the No on Saturday,November 22 at 21:30, for a â€œmixtapeâ€ filled with emotion, memories, andmusical storytelling.A special musical encounter where their own songs, shared influences, andbeloved melodies intertwine to create a living dialogue between voice,guitar, and piano. An acoustic guitar and an electric piano converse andalternate, shaping an atmosphere that feels intimate, personal, andconfessional. The two singer-songwriters perform selections from theirdiscography in their most stripped-down and authentic form, while alsooffering a first glimpse of their upcoming releases.On the â€œsecond side of the tape,â€ the audience will travel through songs oftheir millennial adolescence sounds and artists that shaped their musicalidentity alongside timeless melodies that have left a mark on all of us.Panos Birbas is a songwriter, arranger, and music producer fromAthens. From an early age, he studied guitar, piano, and music theory,participating in numerous bands and festivals in Greece and abroad. He hasreleased the solo albums â€œMournfulâ€ and â€œFinchley Roadâ€, and is the frontmanof Dustbowl, with whom he has shared the stage with acts such as DreamSyndicate and Mark Lanegan. In 2021, he took part in the internationalcompilation â€œSongs from the Fansâ€ celebrating Chris Cacavasâ€™ 60th birthday,alongside artists such as Calexico and Steve Wynn.Irini Qn is a songwriter with a classical music background and studies inpiano and linguistics. After spending some time living in various countriesabroad, she returned to Athens and began writing her own songs turninghuman relationships and social observations into musical confessions. Herdebut album â€œWithout the Bow in the Arenaâ€ (Metronomos, 2020) stood out forits deeply personal tone and emotional intensity, establishing her as one ofthe most compelling new voices in the contemporary Greek songwritingscene. She is currently preparing her second album, with the first single,â€œManiasmeniâ€, set for release in November.

Martha Mavroidi | Smariâ€œNight Flightâ€THEATRE OF THE NOSunday, November 23

A Chamber Music Ensemble Exploring the Sounds of the

Eastern Mediterranean

The ensemble â€œSmariâ€ takes the stage at THEATRE OF THE NO on Sunday,November 23 at 20:00, inviting audiences on a magical â€œNight Flightâ€through the musical landscapes of the Eastern Mediterranean.This chamber music ensemble, combining traditional and classicalinstruments, listens deeply to the music of the world and performs it with awhispering, almost mystical quality, with six musicians whose influences spantraditional Greek, Arab-Persian, and classical music.Five continuous-sound instruments and a voice used as a musical instrumentinteract to form a flexible chamber orchestra. The ensemble includes two neyflutes, lyra, cello, double bass, and voice, exploring how the ancientmusical traditions of Greece and the Middle East can resonate incontemporary times. Melodies rooted in the tropes of the EasternMediterranean coexist with modern harmonies and free improvisation,creating a unique and immersive sonic experience.Smari has performed at prominent cultural venues, including the Festivals ofSacred Music of the Greek National Opera, the School of Attic Drama, theMegaron Athens Concert Hall, and the Anglican Church of St. Paul. Theyhave participated in theatrical productions such as â€œThe Song of Kyra-Domnitsaâ€, commissioned by the Greek National Opera for the 200thanniversary of the Greek Revolution, and â€œMadre Salonicoâ€ with a libretto byLÃ©on Nar.A highlight of their work is the recording of â€œKatalogiâ€, composed by MarthaMavroeidi and based on the MoirÃ³loi of the Virgin Mary, combined withfootage from the documentary â€œIn Her Bodyâ€, presented as a musical video
